name: overgenerosity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being more generous than is helpful or necessary: They met to agree a settlement intended to correct the over-generosity of the previous deal. Their over-generosity with their younger child caused jealousy amongst her older siblings.
More examplesFewer examplesThe teacher's over-generosity in marking resulted from his lack of knowledge of the syllabus and curriculum.As a critic, he could be accused of over-generosity: of praising the mediocre in order to make his own judgments appear refined.It is always a mistake to spoil children by lack of boundaries or overgenerosity.
